properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 8 at 3:58AM EST until February 9 at 3:30AM EST by NWS Wakefield VA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wakefield Va has issued a flood
warning for the following rivers in Virginia...

Nottoway River At Rawlings affecting Brunswick and Dinwiddie
Counties

For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings...Minor flooding is
occurring and is expected to continue.

The National Weather Service in Wakefield Va has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Nottoway River At Rawlings.
* until late tonight...Or until the warning is cancelled.
* At 03:50 AM Saturday the stage was 9.7 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 10.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage by early
this morning and continue to rise to near 10.7 feet by this
afternoon. The river will fall below flood stage by tonight.
* At 10.0 feet...River comes out of its banks in the vicinity of the
gage.
This river level is comparable to a previous crest of 10.6 feet on
Apr 18 2000.
properties.instruction:
Please use extreme caution if venturing near riverbanks. Move to
higher ground immediately should rising water threaten your safety.

Graphical forecast information is available on the internet at
www.weather.gov/akq.  Click on the Rivers and Lakes icon beneath the
point and click forecast map.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather radio for further updates...
